description.narrative: Technical Assistance, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a social protection framework, and monitoring and evaluation systems to improve public policies and social investment and reduce inequity gaps.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative:
The first Comprehensive Early Childhood National Strategy in Argentina was designed and approved (by presidential decree), with UNICEF's advocacy and technical and financial assistance. Technical assistance also contributed to the development of 4 comprehensive early childhood policies at provincial level and 4 local level initiatives.
UNICEF continued to advocate to change social norms and generate a new family leave legislation, alongside CSO and private sector. The innovative “Diamond Model” approach was strengthened from an integrated approached (Programmes, B4R, Communication) and the CO contributed to global and regional discussions on how to implement family-friendly policies at the workplace. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of initiatives (studies, assessments, work documents) that promote the universalization of child-care policies in the social protection system.

baseline.value: Existence of a Comprehensive Policy for Early Childhood Care
